sense.name: an intertwined, twisted physical strands
sense.examples: It took an hour to brush out the tangles in her hair. They used machetes to chop their way through the tangle of jungle vines. The students left a tangle of lines by the boat for their instructor to tidy up.

sense.name: a perplexity of information
sense.examples: We tried to decipher the tangle of regulations on the government form. The book cuts through the tangle of details to give a clear overview of the current state of molecular biology. The whole story seems to be just a tangle of lies.

sense.name: a disagreement, altercation, fight
sense.examples: The police had to break up a tangle in front of the town tavern last night. Pete and Bob got into a tangle over a woman. Mary tried to avoid tangles at work with her contentious boss.

sense.name: a large seaweed
sense.examples: Pieces of green tangle lay along the beach at low tide. Air bladders kept the tangle afloat on the surface of the sea.
